title.narrative: POLICIES, STRATEGIES AND PLANS

description.narrative: Relevant MDAs and select LGAs and CSOs have improved capacities to formulate, implement and monitor evidence-based policies, strategies and plans, which contributes to Early Learning, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Improved and equitable access to and completion of quality, inclusive basic education with a focus on improving learning outcomes

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Relevant MDAs and select LGAs and CSOs have improved capacities to formulate, implement and monitor evidence-based policies, strategies and plans

description.narrative: An additional 97 (out of a targeted 80) senior government officials (45 Zanzibar,52 Mainland) gained knowledge in how to systematically use evidence in planning the implementation of Education Sector Development Plans in both Mainland and Zanzibar, through Bottleneck Analysis Approach (BNA). Consequently, evidence-based solutions aligned to the Sector Plan were incorporated into draft MTEF plans at decentralized levels in Zanzibar. Also, through UNICEF support, the National-Exams-Council of Tanzania(NECTA) now have an inclusive classroom-based assessment system with assessment tools for Reading, Writing, and Arithmetic, laying a solid foundation for ensuring teachers to formatively diagnose and resolve problems in teaching and learning. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:12/11/2019

title.narrative: Service Delivery - Emergency response - UNICEF-targeted children in humanitarian situations accessing formal or non-formal basic education (including pre-primary schools/early childhood learning spaces), see guidance
Number of IP MDAs, LGAs and NGOs officials certified in policy analysis and strategic planning, RBM, monitoring and local accountability in UN-supported regions

target.value: 2021:ML: MDAs 75, LGAs 110, NGOs 25, ZNZ: MDAs 20, LGAS 50, NGOs 6

title.narrative: Service Delivery - Communities - Number of schools that implement school-based management initiatives with UNICEF support
System Strengthening - Learning assessment - Existence of a well-functioning classroom assessment system, including for early grades - score (1-4), see guidance

baseline.value: Score 1: There are no system-level mechanisms to ensure that teachers develop skills in classroom assessment.

target.value: 2021:Score 4: There is a variety of system-level mechanisms to ensure that teachers develop skills in classroom assessment.

actual.value: 2019:School Based Assessment (SBA) Framework and tools for literacy, numeracy and life skills finalized (including 12 Teacher guides for conducting assessments). A draft IT system for enhancing the conduct and practice of SBA is in place. Piloting of the system in selected regions and districts will comm

title.narrative: Country has an effective education systems for learning outcomes, including early learning (Y/N)

baseline.value: high impact quality interventions paackage not defined jonitly by all partners; no national teacher continous professional development framework, no national schoool based assessement system/framework tools in place

target.value: 2020:Guidelines for implementation of national teachers CPD framework in place and assessment tools for teachers piloted and finanized; 50% of targeted school teachers trained in the use of learning assessment tools
